channel.title: DeCartography: a collaborative way to provide a social graph based on human subjective evaluation of address activity on Community Notes Guide
channel.description: Recent content in DeCartography: a collaborative way to provide a social graph based on human subjective evaluation of address activity on Community Notes Guide

item.title: Challenges
item.description: We know that building a distributed oracle like DeCartography has many challenges, including withstanding various hacks, not being dominated by a simple majority, and having a skewed community of contributors (crowd workers). We have been publicly building DeCartography since Jun 24-26, 2022 and are designing it while seeking input from the broader community. Here are a handful of particular challenges we are aware of as well as steps we are taking to address them:

item.title: FAQs
item.description: Frequently Asked Questions Who can join DeCartography as a crowdworker? Anyone can become a crowdworker. Workers must meet several requirements. Please click here for more details. (You cannot get paid in the beta version.) Are my ratings anonymous? Or will my vote be named? We want everyone to feel comfortable participating in DeCartography. Therefore, all crowd workers who participate in DeCartography will be given a new, automatically generated identifier.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Sign up from [here https://decartography.web.app/] Anyone can sign up to contribute as a crowd worker to DeCartography, which is currently in beta. Authenticate with your Google account Go to the screen like this Answer the question
